titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Smith Wingate, Transcript
CWG5100

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: (1) Please before James Pryor Judge of the Owen Circuit Court at the Court house in Owenton on the 14th Novr 1853.

The Commonwealth of Ky Plff
vs } Indictment
Smith Wingate Deft

Be it remembered that heretofore to wit on the 4th day of May 1853 came the Grand Jury Empannelled and sworn for Owen County and returned into Court an Indictment which is in the words and figures following to wit:

Commonwealth of Kentucky
Owen County & Circuit } S. S

The Grand Jury of the Commonwealth of Ky impanneled Sworn & charged as a grand inquest to enquire in and for the county of Owen upon their oath present that Smith Wingate gentleman late of Owen County did from the 1st day of January (A D) 1853. thru months & more in the county of Owen aforesaid Keep a tipling house by then and there selling whiskey and other spirituous liquors in said tippling house to be drank therein. he the said Wingate not then and there having license therefor: contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided & against the peac & dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky, and the Jurors aforesaid upon their oath
(2) aforesaid, do further present, that the afsd Smith Wingate on the 1st day of January (A D) 1853. in the county of Owen aforesaid, did keep a tippling house by then and there selling Whiskey and other spirituous liquors in said tippling house to be drank therein and did continue the keeping of said tippling house from that time until the first day of may (A D) 1853. being three months & more he the said Wingate not then & there having during any of that time a license therefor as by law required contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided & against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

And the Jurors aforesaid upon their oath aforesaid do further present that the aforesaid Smith Wingate on the 1st day of March (A. D.) 1853. in the county of Owen aforesaid did keep a tippling house by then and there selling Whiskey & other spirituous liquors in said tippling house to be drank therein he the said Wingate not having then & there license there for as by law required contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made & provided & against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

And the Jurors aforesaid upon their oath aforesaid do further present that the afsd Smith Wingate in the County of Owen aforesaid on the first day of April AD 1853.
(3) did keep a tippling house without having a license therefors contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made & provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Ky.
Afterwards to wit at a circuit court held for Owen County at the courthouse in Owenton the following Judgement was rendered in this cause to wit;

"Came parties by their attornies and the defendant confessed Judgement on the first count of the Indictment herein, It is therefore considered by the court that the defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of two Hundred dollars toegether with the costs by the Commonwealth in this behalf expended and that he be taken &c On motion of atto for plff it is ordered that the indictment herein be dismissed as to the 2nd & 3rd counts-
I W H Sandford clerk of the Circuit Court for the county afsd do certify that the foregoing 3 pages contain a true and complete transcript of the record and proceedings had in the Court therein named

Owen Cir Ct
vs
Smith Wingate
$200.
Remit
3d Jany/65
